l: 👋 Hi, I'm Romane Devezeaux de Lavergne
p: I am a cybersecurity student with a strong academic and practical background. I completed a Bachelor’s degree in Cybersecurity at Howest (Belgium), and I am currently pursuing a Master’s degree at DSTI in alternance. As part of my work-study program, I am working at CGI, where I continue to develop my technical skills and gain real-world experience in the cybersecurity field.
This website serves as a portfolio to showcase:
🛡️ My experience and progress on Root-Me

Welcome to my cybersecurity journey. Here I share my experiences, insights, and adventures in the field.

After completing my Cybersecurity Bachelor's at Howest and an internship at Apside in Paris, I decided to pursue a Master’s degree in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence at the Data ScienceTech Institute (DSTI) in Paris.
Enterprise IT governance and risk management

I have been passionate about cybersecurity for many years, particularly in the analysis side of the field. Rather than creating new systems, I enjoy studying existing systems, understanding how their components work together, and exploring ways to improve or challenge them. This curiosity drives my interest in:
IT Project Management: Traditional and Agile Approaches
Low-level software engineering and system internals
My studies at DSTI revolve around:
To further develop these skills, I try to engage with online challenges such as root-me or hackthebox, which help me apply theoretical knowledge to practical scenarios.
CGI Alternance (formerly Apside)– Paris, France October 2024 – Present
I continued to work at Apside for my first year of Alternance. My responsibilities include:
Windows administration and secure network configuration
Integrating antivirus, backup, and bastion-based gateways
Implementing air-gapped environments in compliance with CIS/ANSSI guidelines
Previous Internship at Apside– Paris, France February 2024 – June 2024
Assessed cybersecurity tools using ANSSI guidelines
Documented procedures, backup strategies, and administration guidelines
Cybersecurity Guide Development– Building a knowledge base for tools and techniques
Programming– Python, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, Bash, SQL, PowerShell, PHP, HTML/CSS, Markdown
Operating Systems & Tools– Windows, Debian, Kali, Ubuntu, Parrot, TL-OSINT
Cybersecurity & Forensics– Pen-testing, OSINT, malware analysis, threat intelligence, Autopsy, IDA Pro, Immunity Debugger, Security Onion, Wireshark
Enterprise Tools– Backup Exec, Trend Micro Deep Security, BeyondTrust PRA, MongoDB, JetBrains Suite
Networking & Cloud– Network architecture, Cisco configuration, AWS Cloud, secure infrastructure design
Productivity & Design– Microsoft Office 365, Visio, Figma

Worked in a team to reverse engineer compiled code and uncover hidden behavior. Skills Developed: Systematic analysis workflows, professional reverse engineering tools, pressure-tested problem-solving, dual attacker-developer perspective.
Engaged with the European cybersecurity community to explore detection, prevention, and incident response techniques using the MITRE ATT&CK framework.

Explored quantum computing fundamentals with Qiskit and real IBM quantum processors. Why Quantum Matters: Preparing for future threats to encryption and understanding the direction of emerging technology. My approach is gradual, focusing on the deep and challenging aspects of quantum computing.

Performed vulnerability assessments on intentionally outdated servers in a live, attack-and-defend environment. Key Takeaways: Even small oversights, like default passwords, can compromise entire systems. Structured review sessions would improve future editions.
I aim to continue developing expertise in cybersecurity analysis, particularly in:
Certifications planned this year: SC-100 and others as my studies progress.
